summary:
Morphine is a strong pain medicine made from opium poppies. It helps with both acute and chronic pain, like after surgery or for kidney stones. You can take it in many ways, like pills, injections, or suppositories. But be careful, it can be addictive and cause side effects like nausea, drowsiness, and constipation.

First made in the early 1800s, morphine is now a controlled substance. It's used all over the world, especially in developed countries. Some of it is used to make other pain medicines and even heroin.
title: Morphine
